A scientific article, if you mean an article that might appear in a scientific journal, is a summary of research conducted using the scientific method, describing repeatable experiments, that has been peer-reviewed, citing all references. If it relies on results stated in a previous article which is later discredited, the article will have to be peer-reviewed again.
